column4: How long should an encrypted swap partition of 1GB take to start during the boot process? (Yes, I know this is a vague question. I'm looking for a ballpark figure.)
encrypted swap?
Yes. I'm not sure what your implicit question is here.
why encrypt your swap?
just interested, don't have a clue how long it should take to swapon
swap's essentially memory, so it gets sensitive details written to it. Passwords, credit card details, open files, that kind of thing.
So the answer to 'why' is somewhere between 'peace of mind' and 'paranoia'.
protected memory spaces means nothing else can read it (technically), and swap gets wiped
and if you a reasonable amount of RAM swap doesn't even get used
Well, if "they've" got access to a running system you're probably out of luck anyway. If the power gets yanked, though, you can read data out of a swap partition fairly easily.
I suppose... seems quite an odd level of paranoia
if they are in a position to yank your power they'll just twat you with a wrench till you *tell* them the passwords
Ah, that's the joy of it, though! Because you never need to remount swap (it gets cleared on boot) you use /dev/urandom as the key.
